intro: Bupleurum opacum, commonly known as the opacum bugloss, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Bupleurum opacum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments.
